text: Terraria is fun. Everyone should get it because its cheap as shit.
author: thisbarb

text: Minecraft and Terraria aren't meant to be or are rivals. Minecraft provides a better sandbox experience while Terraria is a more action/quest based game. Tbh, I don't build in Terraria except for the mandatory home and shelter for my NPC's, an infinite obsidian, and a boss platform. Unlike the comment below I don't see Terraria as a game that allows players to build anything they can think of, and the game runs short of playability after beating all of the hardmode bosses.
author: Jinxed

text: Certainly a great rival to Minecraft imo. While the exploration isn't necessarily as deep, it offers a little more 'game' than 'sandbox' for those of us looking for something a little more exciting, while still allowing us the freedom to build anything within the bounds of our imagination.
author: Vince Vance

text: I played this game alot when I was starting to get to know to a special person in my life. Funny how this music brings all those memories back to my mind.  Thanks for uploading

author: Jeff1N

text:
@MHPL01 Notch admitted on his twitter he was quite enjoying Terraria, actually.

And while in a way it being a 2D clone seems fair, there's far more exploration, combat, and discovery to be had in Terraria - while the actual 'crafting' part is more Minecraft's strength.  In practice, they feel like two very different games.

author: Cuppa Joe

text:
having played both games to death i can honestly say that i personally enjoy terraria for more than minecraft, mainly because it has deeper gameplay and more of a sense of achievement as well as it is more action packed.... 

dont get me wrong, i love minecraft too but its so hard to get back into that game post terraria... that and it gives me a super headache after playing it for so long

text: I got Terraria during the summer sale, and it's crazy addicting.  I just can't stop playing it in my freetime.  The music in this game is great, too, but not very diverse.  There's maybe 5-6 total songs, which do switch up depending on the situation, but they are reused.  If they added a few more songs, the game would be perfect.

author: Maruhai LeSeul

text: It's really not a bad game, especially if you can manage to get a non-laggy server and gather a team of 4 people dedicated to that server. Interesting music, wonderful 2D graphics, continuing updates and content, and expansive worlds all come together to make the game worth the $10 it costs.
